alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 6:35PM PST until January 01 at 10:32AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish River will remain in minor flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM PST Friday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM PST Friday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday morning and continue falling to 16.4 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 03/06/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued bylate tonight at 245 AM PST.
